summary: coVs represent a group of enveloped, positive-sense, single-stranded viruses with large genomes (27 to 33 kb) they are capable of causing respiratory, enteric, hepatic, and neurological diseases of different severities in diverse animal species, including humans. only alpha-, beta-, gamma-, and delta-CoVs can infect humans. several drugs, such as ribavirin, lopinavir-ritonavir, interferon, and corticosteroids, have been used to treat patients infected with SARS-CoV. contradictory findings on their efficacy and concerns over tolerability and clinical benefit have limited the use of antiviral therapeutics for CoVs. silvestrol was a potent and nontoxic inhibitor of cap-dependent viral mRNA translation in coV-infected human primary cells. a nucleotide prodrug (GS-5734) could inhibit SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV replication in multiple in vitro systems at submicromolar half-maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) values. Optimal screening conditions were established using the rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc reporter virus to infect BHK-21 cells in 96-well plates. under this condition, the coefficient of variation and Z factor were 2.9% and 0.86, respectively. 56 hits were found to significantly inhibit rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc replication. 5 l of rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc was added, and the cells were cultured for an additional 72 h. the percentage inhibition of Rluc activity of rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc is displayed along the vertical axis versus the percentage inhibition of BHK-21 proliferation displayed along the horizontal axis. phenazopyridine, lycorine, pyrvinium pamoate, monensin sodium, cetylpyridinium chloride, oligomycin, loperamide, harmine, and conessine exhibited antiviral activity against severe CoV (MERS-CoV) the spread of rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc in the mouse brain. at 2, 3, and 4 days postinoculation, mice were processed for BLI. data represent the mean standard deviation (error bars) of the results of three independent experiments. the cells were treated in triplicate with 1 l of each compound (diluted in DMSO) at a final concentration of 10 M. after 1 h, 5 l of rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc was added, and the cells were cultured for an additional 72 h. we identified 17 compounds that inhibited the replication of HCoV-NL63 (EC50 5 M), which is an alpha-CoV that causes the common cold. 13 and 12 compounds inhibited MERS-CoV and MHV-A59 replication (EC50 5 M), respectively. the following seven compounds inhibited the replication of all CoVs with EC50 values of 5 M. mycophenolate mofetil 115007-34-6 C13H19NO2 Antifungal 1.48, >20 17.49, >20 15.91, >20 16.39, emetine displayed potent anti-CoV activity and strongest anti-MERS-CoV activity among the top seven inhibitors. mycophenolic acid exerted a significant inhibitory effect on HCoV-OC43 replication, with an EC50 of 1.95 M and an SI of 9.06. phenazopyridine, a widely used urinary analgesic, also displayed strong broad-spectrum anti-CoV activity for the first time. seven broad-spectrum inhibitors of four types of CoVs were infected with HCoV-OC43-WT, MERS-CoV, HCoV-NL63, or MHV-A59 at an MOI of 0.01, respectively. at 72 h postinfection, cell culture supernatants were subjected to a viral load assay, and cell lysates were assessed for cytotoxicity. the inhibitory effect of mycophenolic acid differed according to IFA and Western blot results. the inhibitors clearly suppressed HCoV-OC43 replication. at 72 h postinfection, cells were analyzed by Western blotting. we tested the effect of the seven screened inhibitors on CoV entry using a pseudotype virus with a human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) backbone. only emetine was an entry inhibitor that blocked MERS-CoV S-mediated infection. luciferase activity reduced 50-fold compared with that of the control. female BALB/c mice were inoculated with 100 TCID50 of HCoV-OC43-WT. all mice in the phosphate-buffered saline (PBS)-DMSO-treated group died within 6 days. 83.3% of mice in the lycorine-treated group were still alive at 20 days postinoculation (P 0.001) twelve-day-old female BALB/c mice were inoculated via the intranasal route with 100 TCID50 HCoV-OC43-WT and treated with lycorine or DMSO control for 3 days. at 72 h postinfection, viral loads in the mouse brain and spinal cord were determined by qRT-PCR. rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc activity of rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc in the mouse brain at 72 h postinoculation. data represent the mean standard deviation (error bars) of the results of three independent experiments. combining antiviral peptides with beta interferon (IFN-) can enhance antiviral therapeutic effects. several reports of enhanced therapeutic effects of combinations of other antiviral agents for the treatment of MERS-CoV. lycorine was confirmed as showing strong anti-CoV activity in vivo. lycorine, emetine, monensin sodium, mycophenolate mofetil, phenazopyridine, and pyrvinium pamoate showed inhibitory activity against multiple genetically distinct CoVs in vitro. lycorine is an alkaloid isolated from Amaryllidaceae plants and reportedly exhibits anticancer, antiplasmodial, antitrypanosomal, anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and emetic activities. emetine is reportedly a potent inhibitor that suppresses replication of several RNA viruses without generating drug-resistant variant viruses (54–56). emetine inhibits human cytomegalovirus replication by disrupting the HCMV-induced interaction between p53 and the E3-ubiquitin ligase MDM2 (57). monensin sodium, which affects IBV and MHV-A59 assembly (61, 62), was also identified as an inhibitor of other CoVs. lycorine showed strong antiviral activity against multiple genetically distinct CoVs in vitro and protected mice against lethal HCoV-OC43 infection in vivo. vero-E6, LLC-MK2, DBT, 293FT, DPP4-expressing Huh7.5 cells, and 17Cl-1 cells were cultured in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium. HCoV-OC43 expressing the Rluc gene (rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc) and derived from an infectious cDNA clone (17) was used for HTS in HBK-21 cells. MHV titers were quantified by a plaque assay. the primer and probe sequences were as follows. q-OC43-F, HCoV-NL63, and MERS-CoV were quantified. HCoV-OC43 can replicate efficiently in BHK-21 cells. the primary screening assay was conducted using 10 M each compound. the average control signal was 6.3 106 luciferase light units. the EC50 value and the compound-specific toxicity (CC50) were calculated with GraphPad Prism 5 software (GraphPad, Inc., La Jolla, CA, USA) a confirmation assay was performed using HCoV-OC43-WT treated with the compounds at two concentrations (10 and 5 M) a compound was considered effective only if the EC50 value was 5 M. the cells were fixed in 4% formaldehyde, permeabilized in 0.5% Triton X-100, blocked in 5% bovine serum albumin in PBS. they were then probed with primary antibodies (anti-HCoV-OC43 nucleocapsid protein) for 1 h at room temperature. the cells were then washed and stained with 4,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole. 293FT cells were cotransfected with plasmids PNL4-3.luc.RE- and pVRC-MERS-S. the culture supernatant containing sufficient pseudotyped MERS-CoV was collected at 72 h posttransfection. the culture supernatant was renewed with fresh medium containing 2% FBS. mice were positioned in a specially designed box and placed onto the stage inside the light-tight camera box. mice were imaged within 5 min postinjection of the substrate. a P of 0.05 was considered statistically significant. anti-HCoV-OC43 nucleocapsid protein mouse monoclonal antibody was made in-house. infrared IRDye 800CW-labeled goat anti-mouse IgG and 680RD-labeled goat anti-rabbit IgG were purchased from LI-COR Biosciences (Lincoln, NE, USA) HCoV-OC43 can replicate efficiently in BHK-21 cells. the average control signal was 6.3 106 luciferase light units. 4,000 cells were seeded in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS. the plates were incubated at 37°C for 72 h. luciferase activity was determined using the Renilla-Glo luciferase assay system. a compound was considered effective only if the EC50 value was 5 M. lysates were separated by sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. they were transferred to nitrocellulose membranes, which were blocked with 5% skim milk in PBS for 1 h. the membranes were incubated for 1 h with the appropriate secondary antibody. methyl-thiazolyl-tetrazolium (MTT) was added to a final concentration of 0.5 mg/ml. cells were incubated for 3 h in a humidified 5% CO2 incubator at 37°C. the plates were centrifuged (500 g, 10 min), and the supernatant was removed from each well by aspiration with a micropipette. mice were infected with rOC43-ns2Del-Rluc and treated with lycorine or DMSO-PBS. survival was monitored for 20 days postinoculation.
